usa: At first, the natives were glad to trade provisions to the colonists for metal tools, but by 1609 John Smith began sending raiding parties to demand food. Native Americans were isolated, their houses burnt down, and their food supplies were stolen.<sup id="cite_ref-5" class="reference">[5]</sup> This earned the colonists a bad reputation among the natives and precipitated conflict.<sup id="cite_ref-6" class="reference">[6]</sup><sup id="cite_ref-7" class="reference">[7]</sup>
